byline.original: By PETER BAKER and JENNIFER STEINHAUER

abstract: News Analysis; House Democrats' rejection of trade legislation may not impede signing of Trans-Pacific Partnership in long run, but does reveal sharp divide over economic issues within party; decision to vote against bill despite personal appeals by Pres Obama shows that Democratic lawmakers are no longer as willing to back president at expense of their constituents.
lead_paragraph: Though many Republicans supported President Obama on the trade bill, his fellow Democrats in the House did not, contending that the legislation would exacerbate income inequality.

headline.main: Washington Dysfunction, With a Twist: Democrats Desert Their President
headline.print_headline: In Defeat, a Divide for Obama and His Party

snippet: Though many Republicans supported President Obama on the trade bill, his fellow Democrats in the House did not, contending that the legislation would exacerbate income inequality.
